title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "Starting a Business"
location: Greater Pensacola Chamber of Commerce 418 W Garden St, CO:LAB Bldg, 4th flr Pensacola, FL 32501
description:
So you've got that business idea. You may not know the first steps, or you may want some guidance on if you're taking the right steps. Let's work with the ideas that have been forming in your head and see if we can make them into a tangible, feasible small business. In this three-hour workshop, we'll take a deep dive into the following aspects of setting up a successful business:

 


	Is there a need for your product or service?
	Can you make money at it?
	Are you the right person to bring this to market?
	Is this business compatible with your personal goals?
	What rules, laws, and licensing apply to your business?
	What are funding options for your business?
	What about marketing strategies, legal structures, and taxation?
	What are your available resources?


Also, after attending this workshop you'll have access to a Florida SBDC Business Consultant to assist you at no cost as you create your business plan and move toward your goals!

description:
Leaders are not born; they are developed. We must ensure the success of our community by cultivating talented individuals who will emerge and lead us into the future. There is no better training ground for our future leaders than Leadership Perdido Key (LPK). The keys to the future of Northwest Florida are knowledgeable and skilled leaders who have an awareness and understanding of all facets of our community, including local government, business, tourism/hospitality, environment, military, and more.



Leadership Perdido Key is a comprehensive leadership development program designed to empower individuals with the skills, knowledge, and networking needed to become effective leaders in their communities. 

Participants in Leadership Perdido Key will come from diverse backgrounds and industries, reflecting the community's rich tapestry of talent and expertise. Through a series of workshops, seminars, and experiential learning activities, participants have the opportunity to deepen their understanding of Perdido Key area and hone their leadership capabilities.

The program will feature guest speakers who are prominent leaders in various fields, providing valuable insights.  Additionally, participants may engage in hands-on projects and community initiatives aimed at making a positive impact in Perdido Key and surrounding areas.

Overall, Leadership Perdido Key aims to cultivate a new generation of leaders who are equipped to address the challenges and opportunities facing their communities, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and service.

title: October Spill the Beans, Community Conversations 2025
location: Hub Stacey's at the Point 5851 Galvez Road Pensacola, FL 32507
description:
The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce presents Spill the Beans, Community Conversations, a series designed to bring the local community together to explore topics that have a direct impact on residents and businesses in and around Perdido Key.



Each session provides an opportunity for attendees to learn about key issues and developments affecting the area, followed by a Q&A session to encourage open dialogue. 



This month's speaker is 

Cinnamon Swift, Secret Santa INC. 



Formed in 1992 in Perdido Key, the organization raises funds year-round to support families and children especially at Christmas and during times of urgent medical or housing needs. Each holiday season, they help families shop for gifts, making sure children experience the joy and excitement of Christmas morning. Beyond the holidays, they step in when hardships arise, offering vital assistance and reassurance to those facing difficult times. The spirit of giving is carried on well beyond the holiday season, bringing hope, comfort, and community support throughout the year.



Light pastries and coffee will be available for attendees, provided courtesy of our host, Hub Stacey's at The Point, while supplies last. Whether you're looking to stay informed about local issues or expand your network, Spill the Beans offers a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere to engage with community leaders and fellow business owners.

location: Session Schedule Regular sessions are scheduled from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. They will be held in different locations based on the class session topic. 2025 Opening Reception - August 21 Local Government - September 10 Tourism - October 8 Environment - November 12 Military - December 10 2026 Education & Healthcare January 14 Graduation/Annual Dinner January 20 Class project - TBD While we try to keep sessions consistent, sessions are subject to change depending on unforeseen planning conflicts.
description:
Leaders are not born; they are developed. We must ensure the success of our community by cultivating talented individuals who will emerge and lead us into the future. There is no better training ground for our future leaders than Leadership Perdido Key (LPK). The keys to the future of Northwest Florida are knowledgeable and skilled leaders who have an awareness and understanding of all facets of our community, including local government, business, tourism/hospitality, environment, military, and more.



Leadership Perdido Key is a comprehensive leadership development program designed to empower individuals with the skills, knowledge, and networking needed to become effective leaders in their communities. 

Participants in Leadership Perdido Key will come from diverse backgrounds and industries, reflecting the community's rich tapestry of talent and expertise. Through a series of workshops, seminars, and experiential learning activities, participants have the opportunity to deepen their understanding of Perdido Key area and hone their leadership capabilities.

The program will feature guest speakers who are prominent leaders in various fields, providing valuable insights.  Additionally, participants may engage in hands-on projects and community initiatives aimed at making a positive impact in Perdido Key and surrounding areas.

Overall, Leadership Perdido Key aims to cultivate a new generation of leaders who are equipped to address the challenges and opportunities facing their communities, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and service.

	Can you make money at it?

title: Military Appreciation Committee Meeting
location: Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce Conference Room 15500 Perdido Key Drive Pensacola, FL 32507
description:
Military Appreciation Committee

Meeting: Second Thursday of every month | 9:30 10:30 a.m.



Committee Purpose:

Since 1913, the Perdido Area has proudly held the title of Cradle of Naval Aviation. Our economy, culture, and community are enriched by military members and their families. The Military Affairs Committee is dedicated to honoring that legacy by fostering inclusion, appreciation, and strong connections with those who serve, making the Perdido Area a welcoming place for military families to live, work, and play.



Primary Goals and Activities:


	Bridge the Gap: Connect military families with the local business community by sharing resources and supporting veteran entrepreneurs.
	Celebrate Military Heritage: Educate our community about the rich military history that shapes the Perdido Area.
	Honor & Support: Plan and host signature events that highlight our appreciation for service members and their families, including:
	
		Red, White, and Birdies Golf Scramble 
		Annual Rosamond Johnson Memorial Ceremony 
		Military Appreciation Luncheon 
		Star Spangled Sail   Veterans Day Boat Parade (new for 2025)
	
	
	Invest in the Future: Our committee is working toward sponsoring a local student to attend Starbase Atlantis and/or the National Flight Academy summer programs unique opportunities that inspire the next generation through STEM education and leadership development.

How to Get Involved:

Join us in making a difference! Volunteers can contact Staff Committee Chair, Madelyn Bell, to learn how to participate in meetings, help with events, and support military appreciation efforts.



  Learn more: perdidochamber.com/military-appreciation-committee

The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce's Women Mean Business Committee is proud to present a new event series, Women Mean Business: LeadHer Lunch Series. This series is designed to connect, inspire, and empower women in business. This "power hour" style event is your opportunity to network with other professionals and hear from dynamic local leaders who are making an impact in our community. Event doors will open for 11:00AM for networking and Captain Chandra Newman will begin speaking at 11:30AM. 



Meet our Speaker - Captain Chandra Newman, NAS Pensacola Commanding Officer

Captain Chandra Newman | Commanding Officer, NAS Pensacola (Read Full Bio Here)

Captain Chandra Newman, a native of Inverness, Florida, commissioned in the U.S. Navy in 2002 after earning her B.S. in Education from Troy State University, summa cum laude. She earned her wings in 2004 and later received a Master?s in National Security and Strategic Studies from the Naval War College, along with executive education from the University of Virginia's Darden School of Business. Her career includes operational assignments with HSC-26, disaster relief in Pakistan, deployments aboard multiple Navy vessels, and presidential support at Camp David. She held leadership roles as Assistant Navigator on USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, Operations Officer at HSC-25 in Guam, and Executive Officer at U.S. European Command's C4 Directorate and Joint Cyber Center. As Commanding Officer of HSC-5 Nightdippers, she led global deployments supporting Operations Inherent Resolve and Sentinel, earning the 2019 Battle "E." She also served as a Secretary of Defense Executive Fellow with Raytheon and as Director of Naval Aviation's LEGACY program at CNAF Headquarters.

Captain Newman assumed command of NAS Pensacola on November 15, 2024. Her personal decorations include the Legion of Merit, Defense Meritorious Service Medal, and Navy Commendation Medals (3), among others.

location: Session Schedule Regular sessions are scheduled from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. They will be held in different locations based on the class session topic. 2025 Opening Reception - August 21 Local Government - September 10 Tourism - October 8 Environment - November 12 Military - December 10 2026 Education & Healthcare January 14 Graduation/Annual Dinner January 20 Class project - TBD While we try to keep sessions consistent, sessions are subject to change depending on unforeseen planning conflicts.
description:
Leaders are not born; they are developed. We must ensure the success of our community by cultivating talented individuals who will emerge and lead us into the future. There is no better training ground for our future leaders than Leadership Perdido Key (LPK). The keys to the future of Northwest Florida are knowledgeable and skilled leaders who have an awareness and understanding of all facets of our community, including local government, business, tourism/hospitality, environment, military, and more.



Leadership Perdido Key is a comprehensive leadership development program designed to empower individuals with the skills, knowledge, and networking needed to become effective leaders in their communities. 

Participants in Leadership Perdido Key will come from diverse backgrounds and industries, reflecting the community's rich tapestry of talent and expertise. Through a series of workshops, seminars, and experiential learning activities, participants have the opportunity to deepen their understanding of Perdido Key area and hone their leadership capabilities.

The program will feature guest speakers who are prominent leaders in various fields, providing valuable insights.  Additionally, participants may engage in hands-on projects and community initiatives aimed at making a positive impact in Perdido Key and surrounding areas.

Overall, Leadership Perdido Key aims to cultivate a new generation of leaders who are equipped to address the challenges and opportunities facing their communities, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and service.

Secretary Griffin brings a wealth of business and legal knowledge to the role, with more than 15 years of experience as an attorney handling commercial litigation, employment law, contracts, real estate and more. She is deeply invested in the Tampa and Tallahassee communities, currently serving as a member of the Florida State University Student Affairs Development Council as well as the College of Business Board of Governors, College of Law Board of Visitors, and even previously serving as a member of the Tampa Bay Area Regional Transit Authority.

location: Grand Lagoon Yacht Club 10653 Gulf Beach Highway Pensacola, FL 32507
description:
Join us on Thursday, November 6th, from 11:30 AM to 1:30 PM at the Grand Lagoon Yacht Club to celebrate Military Appreciation Month at our annual Military Appreciation Luncheon.



This special event is dedicated to honoring the brave men and women of our Armed Forces, both active duty and retired, who have served our country with dedication and courage. This is a time to recognize the sacrifices made by our service members and their families and to show our deep gratitude for their unwavering commitment to protecting our freedoms.



We are honored to welcome Commander Brandy T. McNabb, US Navy, Retired. as our guest speaker. Her remarkable leadership and inspiring message will leave you feeling uplifted and proud. This is one event you truly won't want to miss! Deadline to register is October 31st!
KEYNOTE SPEAKER - COMMANDER (Ret) BRANDY T. MCNABB, USN



Cmdr. (Ret) McNabb, a native of Del City, Oklahoma, graduated from Oklahoma Baptist University with a degree in Exercise Science/Kinesiology. She attended Officer Candidate School in Pensacola, Florida, and was commissioned an ensign in 1999 and later earned her wings of gold in October 2000. She is a graduate of the U.S. Naval War College, earning a Master of Arts in National Security and Strategic Studies, and while attending, she was selected for the Halsey Group, a program of operations research and war-gaming.

 

McNabb's operational tours include division officer and aircrew, Carrier Airborne Early Warning (VAW) 123, flying the E-2C Hawkeye in support of Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom; deputy J3, 101st Sustainment Brigade, 101st Airborne Division, Bagram Air Base, Afghanistan; catapult and arresting gear officer (shooter) aboard USS Theodore Roosevelt (CVN 71); and department head, VAW-125 deploying in support of Operations Enduring Freedom and New Dawn.

 

Her shore and staff assignments include instructor naval flight officer at the E-2/C-2 fleet replacement squadron, VAW-120; action officer, Chief of Naval Operations Strategic Action Group (N00Z); commanding officer, Naval Consolidated Brig Chesapeake, Virginia; and operations officer, Joint Forces Staff College.

 

She has been the Naval Aviation Schools Command (NASC) executive officer at Naval Air Station Pensacola, Florida.

McNabb has over 2,600 flight hours in the E-2C Hawkeye. Her personal decorations include the Defense Meritorious Service Medal, Meritorious Service Medal, Air Medal (six awards), Joint Commendation Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal, Joint Achievement Medal, Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal, and various unit/campaign awards.

title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "When Banks Say 'No'"

description:
It's tough for small businesses to get funding. In fact, 75-80% of small business loan requests are denied by banks. So, what's a small business owner to do when the bank says no? Find alternative funding sources! "When Banks Say No" provides an overview of alternative funding options for small business owners who need money to start, support, or grow their businesses.

 

Takeaways you'll receive from this webinar:

 

1. Hope! A "no" from the bank is not the end of the road. There are many options available for nearly any business situation.

2. Understanding! We'll explain many funding options that banks just don't offer. One might be just what you need.

3. Direction! When you identify one or two loan options that work for you, you can take the steps towards acquiring that money to start, support, or grow your business.

 

Presenter: S. Boyd Karren, Managing Partner, Otro Financial. While he can help businesses in any stage of growth, Boyd specializes in finding funds for start-ups and businesses under two years old, which is the most difficult time for a business to get funding. Boyd has helped many businesses find the money they needed, even after banks told them no.

 

Please note, this is a virtual event. We'll see you online!

title: Spring Baby Shower Open House
location: Wildlife Sanctuary of Northwest Florida
description: Spring is the time for babies and baby showers. The Wildlife Sanctuary of Northwest Florida is hosting a Spring Baby Shower Open House on March 22, 2025, from 12 pm to 3:30 pm. The annual event is a fundraising event open to the public and is free of charge. The family friendly event will feature birds of prey, special guests, and children's activities. It is also a supply drive. You can find a list of supplies on their website at www.PensacolaWildlife.com and Facebook page. Each year, Spring is the busiest time at the Wildlife Sanctuary, with nature becoming more active after winter. Many new babies are brought in for care, whether orphaned, abandoned, or injured. Emily Holden, Sanctuary Director, mentioned that between 300 to 600 animals and birds arrive each month during Spring and Summer. In Spring, the majority are mammals, while in Summer, it's songbirds. Overall, about 90% of the arrivals are babies. The Spring Baby Shower Open House helps replenish supplies used during these months. Commonly needed supplies include paper towels, tissue, bleach, Simple Green, copy paper, bird seed, mealworms, pine straw, Dawn dish soap, 13-gallon drawstring trash bags, liquid laundry soap, first-class or Forever postage stamps, fresh produce (excluding citrus or spinach), and fresh or frozen bait fish. Gift cards to stores like Walmart, Aldi, Publix, Lowes, Home Depot, or Amazon are appreciated, as are monetary donations. The Wildlife Sanctuary of Northwest Florida is located at 105 North S Street, Pensacola, FL 32505. It is a registered 501c3 non-profit in the state of Florida, serving Escambia, Santa Rosa, and Okaloosa counties.

Join us as we celebrate four decades of community, collaboration, and excellence at the Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce's 40th Annual Meeting & Awards Celebration. Featured Guest Speaker



Darien Schaefer, President/CEO Visit Pensacola

Darien is the President & CEO for Visit Pensacola, joining the organization in April of 2020.

Born in Milwaukee, WI and growing up in the resort community of Wisconsin Dells, Darien has been involved in the hospitality and tourism industry his entire life. A graduate from the University of Wisconsin-Stout with a degree in Hotel/Restaurant Management, Darien spent nine years in hotels including Holiday Inn Corporation, Marriott Hotels and Tharaldson Lodging where he served as an Area Director over 13 hotels.

Darien has 25 years of Destination Marketing experience that includes sports event and festival event development. Darien has represented five destinations in three states including Wisconsin, California and now Florida. Prior to arriving in Pensacola, Darien was the President & CEO for Visit Big Bear representing the resort destination of Big Bear Lake, California.

Visit Pensacola is the destination marketing organization for Escambia County which includes Pensacola, Pensacola Beach and Perdido Key. Visit Pensacola supports the community vision of tourism by serving as the central body responsible for building tourism as an economic engine for our community through leadership, connection, collaboration and communication.

Most recently, Darien became the Board Chair for the Northwest Florida Beaches Tourism Council, a regional marketing organization that represents 8 counties in the Florida Panhandle. In April 2024, the Triumph Gulf Coast Board awarded $10.5 Million to Visit Florida and the NWFL Tourism Council to market the Northwest Florida Beaches.

title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "Starting a Business"
location: Greater Pensacola Chamber of Commerce 418 W Garden St, CO: LAB Bldg, 4th flr Pensacola, FL 32501
description:
So you've got that business idea. You may not know the first steps, or you may want some guidance on if you're taking the right steps. Let's work with the ideas that have been forming in your head and see if we can make them into a tangible, feasible small business. In this three-hour workshop, we'll take a deep dive into the following aspects of setting up a successful business:

 


	Is there a need for your product or service?
	Can you make money at it?
	Are you the right person to bring this to market?
	Is this business compatible with your personal goals?
	What rules, laws, and licensing apply to your business?
	What are funding options for your business?
	What about marketing strategies, legal structures, and taxation?
	What are your available resources?


Also, after attending this workshop you'll have access to a Florida SBDC Business Consultant to assist you at no cost as you create your business plan and move toward your goals!

 

*UWF students and employees may attend SBDC workshops at no cost. Contact us at 850-474-2528 to register with your Nautilus Card number.

 

Please note: No refund credit without 48-hour notice. Contact us at sbdc@uwf.edu or 850-474-2528 with questions.

 

Brought to you in part by Wells Fargo.

description:

Imagine having your entire business plan condensed onto a single, powerful page! Join us for an engaging and hands-on workshop led by experienced SBDC business consultant, Jennifer Rohus, where you'll dive into the Business Model Canvas.

 

This isn't just another dry lecture. You'll actively learn how to map out your business's vision, strategy, and operations in a way that's both simple and incredibly effective. Whether you're just starting your entrepreneurial journey, navigating exciting growth, or gearing up to seek funding, this workshop is your roadmap to success.

 

Speaking of funding, we'll also illuminate potential lending sources and show you how this foundational work with the Business Model Canvas can significantly boost your chances of securing the capital you need.

 

Don't let this opportunity slip away! Sign up now and transform your business strategy into an actionable one-page powerhouse!

The Perdido Key Area Chamber of Commerce presents Spill the Beans, Community Conversations, a monthly series designed to bring the local community together to explore topics that have a direct impact on residents and businesses in and around Perdido Key. Since 1981, Pensacola Habitat has built over 1,650 homes in the Escambia and Santa Rosa County areas. They help families find strength, stability and self-reliance through affordable homeownership. title: Pvt. Rosamond Johnson Memorial Ceremony 2025
location: Rosamond Johnson Beach, Gulf Islands National Seashore, Pensacola, FL 32507
description:
Pvt. Rosamond Johnson Memorial Ceremony

 

The Perdido Key Chamber of Commerce, in partnership with the Gulf Islands National Seashore, is proud to announce its annual Private Rosamond Johnson Memorial Ceremony. The ceremony will take place Saturday, May 3, 2025 at 10 am under the Star Pavilion on Johnson Beach, which is part of the Gulf Islands National Seashore.



The ceremony will honor and remember the life of Army Private Rosamond Johnson Jr.

 

After enlisting in the Army at only 15, Johnson died in combat at age 17. Johnson rescued two injured soldiers and brought them to safety before he was fatally wounded while returning for a third comrade. He was the first Escambia County resident to die in the Korean War. Johnson posthumously received the Purple Heart on August 21, 1950.

 

During the time of Johnson's death, Pensacola beaches were racially segregated. After the Korean Conflict, the county-owned recreational area was renamed to honor its fallen hero at the suggestion of the Sunset Riding Club, Inc. The club leased the land in 1950 from the county for the sole use of bathing, beach and recreational facilities for "colored citizens."



Although the lease was cancelled in 1956, the name Rosamond Johnson Beach remained. The area became part of Gulf Islands National Seashore May 8, 1973. A permanent monument in his honor was erected at Johnson Beach on June 10, 1996.

 

Every year, the Perdido Key community spends a day on Johnson Beach with its citizens and Johnson's family, honoring his memory and sacrifices. 



We appreciate your support and involvement. For more information on this celebratory day, please go to Perdidochamber.com or our Visitors Information Center, located at 15500 Perdido Key Drive, Perdido Key, Fla.

title: Education in Motion
location: Tropic Falls
description:
Embark on an exhilarating journey through the wonders of physics at Tropic Falls! Gravity, inertia, and centripetal force come alive in this thrilling adventure, making science an unforgettable experience for your class. Education In Motion presents a STEM-based field trip that seamlessly blends education with excitement, promising a day of unparalleled learning.



Our carefully crafted learning materials provide students with self-guided instructions on the principles of physics and how it relates to the rides at Tropic Falls. From K-12, students will immerse themselves in the world of gravity, centripetal motion, inertia, potential and kinetic energy, as well as the intriguing distinctions between negative and positive G-forces. Delve into the realm of animatronics in our indoor dark ride, Mystic Mansion, where the science behind the magic is unveiled.



Whether your students are homeschooled, attend private school, or engage in virtual learning, all school-aged children are enthusiastically welcomed!



During our exclusive Education in Motion field trip days, Tropic Falls opens its gates solely to our groups from 9 am to 3 pm. Revel in the excitement of Tropic Falls' attractions while gaining insights into physics in a safe and enjoyable environment. Limited spots are available, so seize the opportunity and reserve your spot today! Ask about our affordable meal plans and refillable drink bottles!



Please note that Education in Motion requires a minimum of 15 guests per group, and all attendees must purchase a ticket for admission. Don't miss out on this unique educational experience!

title: Florida SBDC at UWF Presents "When Banks Say 'No'"
location: Please note, this is a virtual event. We'll see you online!
description:
It's tough for small businesses to get funding. In fact, 75-80% of small business loan requests are denied by banks. So, what's a small business owner to do when the bank says no? Find alternative funding sources! "When Banks Say No" provides an overview of alternative funding options for small business owners who need money to start, support, or grow their businesses.

 

Takeaways you'll receive from this webinar:

 

1. Hope! A "no" from the bank is not the end of the road. There are many options available for nearly any business situation.

2. Understanding! We'll explain many funding options that banks just don't offer. One might be just what you need.

3. Direction! When you identify one or two loan options that work for you, you can take the steps towards acquiring that money to start, support, or grow your business.

 

Presenter: S. Boyd Karren, Managing Partner, Otro Financial. While he can help businesses in any stage of growth, Boyd specializes in finding funds for start-ups and businesses under two years old, which is the most difficult time for a business to get funding. Boyd has helped many businesses find the money they needed, even after banks told them no.

 

Please note, this is a virtual event. We'll see you online!
